alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 02 at 8:50PM CDT until April 05 at 4:36PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Leroy affecting Clarke and Washington Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Leroy. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24 feet, flooding of low lying farm and pasturelands begins. Cattle in low lying areas should be moved to higher ground. At 30 feet, roads along the east side of the river near Jackson begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 25.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 24 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
